metadata.title: CVE-2019-15903 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
chromium-browser package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1').
expat package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-2').
firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
insighttoolkit4 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
sitecopy package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1').
wbxml2 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
